meanings.definition: To drill a hole before inserting a screw or nail.
meanings.sent1: Before I can attach the shelf, I need to predrill the holes.
meanings.sent2: The carpenter always predrills before securing any wood pieces together.
meanings.sent3: The eager squirrel tried to predrill an acorn into the ground for safekeeping.
meanings.sent4: Her words seemed to predrill into his heart, leaving a lasting impact.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the drill predrilling the wood echoed through the workshop.

meanings.definition: A hole drilled before inserting a screw or nail.
meanings.sent1: Make sure the predrill is deep enough to hold the screw securely.
meanings.sent2: The carpenter grabbed a predrill to prepare for attaching the hinges.
meanings.sent3: The tiny predrill in the wall held the picture frame perfectly.
meanings.sent4: The predrill in the wood acted as a guide for the screw to follow.
meanings.sent5: The predrill prevented the wood from splitting when the screw was inserted.
